titles.title: Northern Nevada Economic Development, Conservation and Military Modernization Act of 2020

To modernize the Fallon Range Training Complex in Churchill County, Nevada, through the withdrawal and reservation of additional public lands for military use, to allow for transfer of ownership of certain Federal parcels in Nevada, to allow for disposal of Federal lands in Nevada for economic development, to make technical corrections to existing law, for conservation, and for other purposes.
Northern Nevada Economic Development, Conservation and Military Modernization Act of 2020
Churchill County Checkerboard Resolution Act
Fallon Range Training Complex Land Withdrawal Act of 2020

Municipal Conveyances within Churchill County Act
National Forest Small Tracts Act Amendments Act
Pershing County Economic Development and Conservation Act
Ruby Mountains Protection Act
Stillwater and Grimes Point National Conservation Areas Act

term.name: Wilderness and natural areas, wildlife refuges, wild rivers, habitats

bill.summary:
Northern Nevada Economic Development, Conservation and Military Modernization Act of 2020
This bill provides for the designation, withdrawal, conveyance, exchange, sale, or disposal of certain federal and nonfederal lands in Nevada, including land associated with the Fallon Range Training Complex.
The bill designates the Stillwater and Grimes Point National Conservation Areas and specified parcels of federal land as wilderness and as components of the National Wilderness Preservation System.
The Department of the Interior and the Department of Agriculture shall not issue an oil or gas lease within the area identified as National Forest System Lands as depicted on the map titled S. 258 Ruby Mountains Protective Act and dated December 5, 2019.
The bill establishes a federal complex for specified Bureau of Land Management, Forest Service, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Bureau of Reclamation, and Bureau of Indian Affairs offices or headquarters in Nevada.
The bill requires the issuance of corrective patents for private lands adjacent to public land in White Pine County when (1) a cloud on the title demonstrates that the private land had been patented before 1976, and (2) the correction is for five acres or less.
